tripreview.Title: "Good place to hang on for few minutes"
tripreview.sentence: Its a serene place.

tripreview.Title: "Average waterfall"
tripreview.sentence: This is not a high waterfall as one would expect.
The entry fee of Rs 10 helps in some semblance of cleaniness.
The place can be avoided if you do not plan to go towards Chinnar or are shot of time.

tripreview.Title: "Take a dip"
tripreview.sentence: On way to Coimbatore from Munnar you will come across the roaring sound of the water fall.
It falls from a short distance but with thrust and creating a pool of flowing water.

tripreview.Title: "Must visit"
tripreview.sentence: This waterfall gives you an oppurtunity to actually immerse yourself in the waters instead of just watching them.
Its safe and very photogenic.

tripreview.Title: "Nature at it's best"
tripreview.sentence: Though we wouldn't take a dip here, the view and the very first view of the falls was amazing.

tripreview.Title: "Awesome waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: Excellent water falls on the way to Munnar.
Nice place.
Enjoyed the photo session here.
They could come up with some good restaurants near by.

tripreview.Title: "Must visit place near Munnar...."
tripreview.sentence: I was on a solo trip to visit Lakkam Waterfalls in Kerala.
Google Maps showed that Lakkam waterfalls, a major tourist attraction, especially during monsoons, was just 1 km from Marayoor Town(On the Udumalpet-Munnar Highway).
But on landing there, I realized that the waterfalls was actually 12 kms uphill from Marayoor.
Thankfully, there are enough Autos offering to take you to the falls.
I paid Rs 250 for the 25km round trip from Marayoor to Lakkam.
The waterfalls is situated bang on the road to Munnar.
From the ticket counter at the entrance, it just takes a couple of minutes walk to reach the falls area.
The place was in its full glory because of the rains.
There are enough spots to take bath safely even during the monsoons and I had a wonderful time in the ice cold water.
Intermittent drizzle only added to the experience.
Kerala Govt.
has made very nice arrangements for the visitors by providing Locker facilities and Changing rooms.
There are enough restaurants near the falls providing both veg and non veg delicacies.
One Sneha Restaurant dishes out specialties like Quail(kaadai) Eggs and Fry.
Rice suited to both Tamilnadu and Kerala tastes are available.
As soon as I stepped out from the water, my mind was firmly made up for a return visit with family before the season runs out.
All in all, a fabulous place to enjoy just 25 kms from Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Nice Waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: This waterfalls is best visited during the onset of the monsoon when it is still not too forceful to wash you away.
this place has changing rooms and lockers and toilet facilities.
This place is too crowded on weekends during the peak tourist season and is better avoided on those days.

tripreview.Title: "Good Place to visit"
tripreview.sentence: Good waterfalls, loaded during Monsoon yet safe.

tripreview.Title: "Gushing waters at full flow in monsoons"
tripreview.sentence: This one is right on the road up to Munnar.
The view from the road would however not be as fulfilling as it would be after covering a few extra meters
maybe 100 and then you see the roaring waters rushing past every hurdle on its way.
The sight of frothy white waters in full flow is soothing to the eye, at least to a hydrophile like me.
It is a nice place to pay a visit in monsoons.
You need to get tickets to see it from the vantage point though.

tripreview.Title: "Overcrowded place"
tripreview.sentence: You will find people, some of them drunk, sinking their bellies in water making it inaccessible to your family.
I went there and chose to stay at distance to avoid being amongst the potentially misbehaving crowd.

tripreview.Title: "Coooool"
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful waterfall with nice cooling atmosphere.
You can enjoy your bath with beautiful breeze and greenery around.
And ya one good thing that lockers are also provided for keeping your valuables.
Bathrooms and toilets are also there by the side.
Good picnic point.
Outside of this area there are small food tents with delicious snacks.
Just try when you are there.
We visited in January 2014.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: We all friends went into water and enjoyed it thoroughly.
Good part is that there are proper bathrooms and locker facilities available.

tripreview.Title: "Waterfall"
tripreview.sentence: The scenic view is amazing but we can't go near.
I can not explain in words about the view of this water fall.
I thing this should be one the amazing water fall in the country.

tripreview.Title: "Breathtaking!!"
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful waterfalls!
Great views, nice breeze, fresh air, the sound of water
You know what I mean!

tripreview.Title: "Natural water spa"
tripreview.sentence: Excellent waterfalls, felt like spa treatment for the skin and hair apart from the adventure.
Water is clear and clean and the speed of the falls is an enjoyable experience.
Toilets available near the falls.

tripreview.Title: "Have fun in Water"
tripreview.sentence: A rocky waterfall.
Water is crystal clear.
A clean place with not too many tourists.
Take one extra pair of clothes if you are taking bath.
Changing rooms are available.
No hotels around for lunch.

tripreview.Title: "Easy accessible and strong falls"
tripreview.sentence: Its very easily accessibly with a 2 mins walk on a pukka platform/steps and very beatiful with strong currents.
A clean toilet is also there.

tripreview.Title: "refresh your body in chilled water and have a fun"
tripreview.sentence: surround by tall trees when a running water sound comes in your ear, your mind force you go get down from your car and go in direction from which this sounds comes.
when you find this water fall, a smile comes on your face and your eyes becomes bright and your body wants to jump in chilled water for fun.
so just go there and enjoy.
please beware of water level it can be suddenly increase due to any reason.

tripreview.Title: "Wonderfull Rocky Falls !!"
tripreview.sentence: We headed to this fall while our return from Munnar to Coimbatore as its enroute.
You wont even realize as you reach the place as it as a special entry to the falls via small buling block.
The Water fall was great with rocky areas to walk through .
The water fall was very safe for trekkers as you can walk along the fall to the fall area and enjoy the sprinkles of the fall upon your body.
We really had great time here.

tripreview.Title: "This is the only falls to take bath in Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: they will charge Rs10 per head you can take photos and bath too.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely waterfalls on way to Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: Lovely waterfalls on way to Munnar, made more lovely due to the onset of monsoons.
Fresh and clean water was a love.

tripreview.Title: "Small but beautiful"
tripreview.sentence: The Lakkam waterfalls is on the Udumalpet- Munnar road before the Munnar town.
It is a beautiful water falls with the falling water forming a puddle where in you can take bath.
Also you can walk across the puddle to the falls but one has to be careful because the surface is filled with pebbles and small rock pieces and not sand.
There is bigger falls above this but no public access.
The location is beautiful surrounded by trees.
There is a small shop at the entrance selling tea and snacks.
There is an entry fee.

tripreview.Title: "Must visit to Lakkam Waterfall in Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: Nice place to visit.
It is almost 25-30 Km from munaar.
This is the waterfall where you can go in the middle of waterfall and enjoy shower of natural clean and cold water.
Photographer can take lots of shots near to this waterfall but you have to go around 09:00 AM - 11:00 AM so you can take shot of waterfall without any tourists.
Overall good place to chill out.

tripreview.Title: "Please suggest"
tripreview.sentence: can any one pls tel can we bath here and wil it be suitable go tis month ?
is ter water flowing ?

tripreview.Title: "superb spot"
tripreview.sentence: This is much far away from the munnar, its almost like a private waterfall because of less crowd.
Bettet option even its a family trip.
from munnar its in the way to marayoor.

tripreview.Title: "Mini water falls amidst nature"
tripreview.sentence: The water falls is very close the main road and can be easily reached.
For travellers on the udumalapet munnar road, it is certainly advisable to stop by and enjoy the sight.
The water falls is located right inside the forest and it is pleasant experience to walk into the water.
It is advisable to put some safety railings help elderly tourists.

tripreview.Title: "one of the best spots in munnar"
tripreview.sentence: lakkam falls is one of the best spot in munnar.
one can go below the falls even in summer.
the water is crystal clear.
it is great spot to spend 2-3 hours with friends and family.

tripreview.Title: "Too far and crowded"
tripreview.sentence: This falls is quite far from Munnar town.
It makes sense to stop here only if you are taking munnar-udumaipet route for travelling in or out.
Like any other waterfall in India, it was crowded with semi-naked middle aged men.
It doesn't make a very good sight to watch.

tripreview.Title: "No hotels around for lunch"
tripreview.sentence: Go for cup noodles or topramen/maggie.
It is hygienic but go for the shop that is inside the campus at the entrance.

tripreview.Title: "Good falls"
tripreview.sentence: Nice falls and yet untouched by the crowds, even in peak season.

tripreview.Title: "Lakkam Water falls"
tripreview.sentence: Located on the Udumelpet - Munnar road.
We had very nice bath there.

tripreview.Title: "Good experiance"
tripreview.sentence: It was a good place to hang around with friends.
Its located on the road towards munnar.
We as a group of 10 people enjoyed a lot there.

tripreview.Title: "Good for bath other wise dont'go"
tripreview.sentence: Munnar - Lakkam watterfalls journey is superb.
Try bike that will be the best journey in your life in Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "A quaint waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: Lakkam waterfalls is set in a scenic and quiet location.
The water is crystal clear and we can walk a short distance in the chill water and sit on rocks watching the falls!
We had been in April were the Shola trees had leaves of different colours.
It was beautiful to see the different colours!
It would help to wear washable footwear while going to Lakkam waterfalls.

tripreview.Title: "Nice waterfall"
tripreview.sentence: Take along your bathing gear.
You can enjoy a fresh bath at this fall.
A clean place with not too many tourists.

tripreview.Title: "Allow this Waterfall to give you a Natural Head Message"
tripreview.sentence: Its a must visit in the summer months before Monsoon.
Its a perennial Fall which during summers is sparse and hence you can approach it and take a dip in its ponds.

tripreview.Title: "Decent waterfall"
tripreview.sentence: You can see this falls if you are driving on Munnar-Udumalpet road.
It's a small falls and if you plan to dip yourself in the water you can.
Rest room and changing room facilities are available, if you are tired of driving you can halt here for sometime and you can take rest.
Enough water was there when we went.

tripreview.Title: "beautiful waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: we had a lovely bath for 3 hours in lakkam, since there was slight drizzle, it was so superb.
will recommend this place.

tripreview.Title: "Great experience!!!"
tripreview.sentence: Lakkom water falls: It is one of the tourist attractions located at a distance of 30-35kms from Munnar on Udumalaipettai road
It is a 3 stage cascading water fall
Only the second and the third stage can be seen by the side of the main road
But however if we want to see the first stage, we have to go on a small trek.
A person appointed by Govt of Kerala will guide us through the forest to see the 1st stage of the water falls
We have to walk through the forest, man made hanging bridges, small rocks etc taking the support of prop roots from trees
Not very tedious and it just takes about 20-25mins to reach that spot
On reaching that spot, a magnificent sight of the first stage of the Lakkom water falls can be seen
Of course surrounded by dense forest in the western ghats range, huge rocks makes the place an excellent tourist spot
If you have missed this and want to experience trekking,make sure you visit this place

tripreview.Title: "nice falls"
tripreview.sentence: its a pretty good falls as long its not crowded, we spent a lot of time there also had a wonderful bath.
you need to be very careful around the rocks not to slip.

tripreview.Title: "Nice place"
tripreview.sentence: Picturesque journey to the falls.
The place is also nice.
There is a small tea joint at the entrance which serves great tea, made to order.
You are allowed to bathe in the waterfalls.

tripreview.Title: "Small but beautiful"
tripreview.sentence: The waterfalls make for a nice short visit and you can take a dip in the water just after the falls to cool off.
The falls themselves are not exceedingly tall or large but they are still quite pretty.
That said, the falls are a good distance from Munnar and it is probably not worth driving to see them in particular unless you're en route to another sight.

tripreview.Title: "nice waterfall"
tripreview.sentence: too many monkeys around here
nice mango slices are available is so cheap price just rupees 10.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent get way from normal life"
tripreview.sentence: We liked the days we stayed in Elaecoland and trips organised by them which were adventurous, enjoyable and enriching, and we look forward to come again.
We have nothing to comment against Ela, Since all were well organised and we did not waste our time.

tripreview.Title: "Great View."
tripreview.sentence: Great view.
Photographers paradise especially during rainy season.
Great Landscapes !
Nice Breeze and hair raising ambiance.

tripreview.Title: "Enjoyable place to stop and cool off."
tripreview.sentence: We really enjoyed our stop at these falls.
The water was lovely and cool and clear and it was a great people watching place.

tripreview.Title: "Best attraction in Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: It is about 10+ kms from the Munnar town on the way to Chinnar.
It is right on the main road and one has to walk for few meters to get to the falls.
When we went in end of December '13, water level is good in the falls.
Water is chill and clean.
One has to go through the knee level water to get to the falls.
I was told that the water level will be very high during the rainy season and people will not be allowed to venture into waters.
It is the best attraction in Munnar without any doubt.
My son has enjoyed this place very much.
They charge an entry fee of Rs 10 and no additional fee for Camera.
Toilet and Locker (as per the notice board) facilities are available.

tripreview.Title: "A small waterfall, a valuable visit"
tripreview.sentence: Review Details: 1.
Reaching the Waterfall was an Interesting and Unusual part [Since we didn't remove our Foot Wear :D], 2.
Again a Photo shoot spot 3.
Can enjoy by immersing and get WET [if doing so carry a pair of extra clothes] 4.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent Waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: On the way to Udumalaipet you can find this place of attraction.
Entry Ticket is Rs10 and no fee is charged for Camera(Highly Surprising) - One can enjoy definitely here.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing place, Worth the trek to the top!"
tripreview.sentence: We were enjoying walking in the cold water and taking pictures with the waterfall when we noticed that there was as path leading higher.
We asked the bathroom attendant, and he instructed us to purchase a ticket at the bottom.
It was well worth the additional payment because if you go higher, you can see a much larger fall that leads into the bottom falls.
It was unbelievably beautiful, and a steep climb is rewarded by the cool falling waters.

tripreview.Title: "Good to play in the water and take pics..."
tripreview.sentence: We Encountered this Falls on the way to Munnar from Conoor
This was an unplanned visit but was more enjoyable.
You can get into the water and reach the falls and place in teh water.
Looks like it is completely safe to play.
Good for taking pics.
Make sure you visit when there is not much crowd.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: This is a small but beautiful waterfalls, clean but crowded.
Being on the way to Munnar, this is quite accessible.

tripreview.Title: "so beautiful place"
tripreview.sentence: Here viewing location is so beautiful and also the water is so chill.
while getting into water i have struggled a lot but after its become normal.

tripreview.Title: "awesome!"
tripreview.sentence: beautiful!
stunning!
pristine!
first time to Lakkam waterfalls although been to munnar a number of times!
there wasn't a big crowd when we got there and that just added to the beauty of the place!
can get really close to the falls, just have to be careful as the stream could get rapid at some areas.
a must do , if visiting munnar!
take a change of cloth, if wanting to enjoy it to the fullest!

tripreview.Title: "Must visit for every couple"
tripreview.sentence: Very calm and romantic spot for couples.
We chat there for almost an hour listening to the sounds of the fall.
It is very nicely built up by government for tourists.

tripreview.Title: "Nice fall, but too crowded"
tripreview.sentence: The falls looked good, but there were scores of folks trying to take bath or walk under it.
There were even entire families standing around applying oil and getting ready to jump in!

tripreview.Title: "very refreshing waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: been to lakkam every time i visit munnar.
the water is very chilly, yet refreshing.

tripreview.Title: "Good Place"
tripreview.sentence: Very nice flow and scenic, just off the Coimbatore highway.
Those traveling from Bangalore, can stop and have a quick shower before entering Munnar.
The Kerala tourism also arranges for eco-tours from here till the Chinnar Scantuary.
Beware of leeches.

tripreview.Title: "Small but beautiful waterfall"
tripreview.sentence: The waterfall may not be a majestic huge fall as seen from the lower end of it but it's quite a Beauty on it's own.
To view the actual bigger version of it, one needs to trek for around 400-500 feet.
The climb although little stiff at places but easily doable.
My 6 year old kid did this - his first trekking :) View enroute was quite nice and as you reach the top it was stunning.
With the Fall on your back and mountains in front !
- we sat there for some time enjoying the beauty.
Highly recommended.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful"
tripreview.sentence: Have to pay fee to go in , But not much we can see there because the big waterfall on the top and not save to go , so we just at the bottom and see the small water fall.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful"
tripreview.sentence: It is worth visiting this place.
Since it is very close to the main road, we need not waste more time to reach.

tripreview.Title: "Sit here for atleast 30 Min"
tripreview.sentence: You need to sit here and feel the mist coming out of the fall and the flow of water give a pleasant music.
you will forget all for these 30 min.
request you to maintain the cleanliness and don't litter.

tripreview.Title: "MUST VISIT"
tripreview.sentence: its an excellent waterfall where you can almost go under the falls and have fun there.
very scenic, right in the middle of the forest.
we had Pouring rains, cold winds.
and the waterfall was really chilly, yet we braved and went in.
totally worth it.

tripreview.Title: "attractive waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: They were lush and tempting waterfalls.
clear waters gushing at a very fast pace from their source.

tripreview.Title: "amazing"
tripreview.sentence: What a sight for sore eyes
The falls inspire poetry, love, forgiveness, a sense of wellbeing that no amount of money can buy.
Revel in the absolute breath taking beauty of these falls.

tripreview.Title: "One of the better waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: One of the better waterfalls and worth the climb on the stairs.
Although right at the top it is very slippery and muddy but the view is worth it.

tripreview.Title: "Hidden surprise"
tripreview.sentence: These falls are hidden from view while driving by.
We stopped out of curiosity and were rewarded by beautiful falls.
Unfortunately there were lot of excited bathers but the majestic falls during a relatively dry season in Munnar were very pleasant sight still.
The drive to the falls is beautiful as most drives in the area are.
So if you can squeeze in a visit, do stop by.
The ginger tea near ticket window is great tasting!

tripreview.Title: "Lakkam"
tripreview.sentence: Excellent.
Get prepared to get some water on you.
Great place,,, You will see signboard saying dont enter water
But you will find lot of people around in deep water enjoying.

tripreview.Title: "Nothing to see in April month"
tripreview.sentence: ALl waterfalls are good if its raining.
IN April all are dried up.

tripreview.Title: "copy of Abbi Falls, Madikeri"
tripreview.sentence: If you are visiting munnar in raining season only u visit this place, if u visited Abbi falls in Madikeri, Karnataka, avoid this place, it looks just a copy of that!

tripreview.Title: "Amazing fall.."
tripreview.sentence: This was a great experience.
Starting from first, i liked the view (water filled with abound stones, big rocks in between, and a waterfall from a distant sight).
When i entered in, the water was surprisingly chilled even at afternoon hours.
A few steps in and you are comfortable enough to reach all the way to the waterfall.
The fall has well-controlled flow, i would say, enough to go beneath it.
Its completely safe not only for adults, but kids too with of course a little extra care.
Overall, its worth visiting if you are in Munnar.
Its pleasantly soothing.
Enjoy.

tripreview.Title: "A Beautiful and safe waterfall"
tripreview.sentence: The best waterfall to enjoy with a family, it is safe and secure with guards.

tripreview.Title: "lakkom falls"
tripreview.sentence: nice location with some colorful flowers in the middle of lush green munnar.
it was very cold water even in the hot afternoon
spray of cold water gifted by the rocks gives immense pleasure and relax to mind
then enjoyed it by bathing in the chilled water and spent more than two third of an hour in lakkom falls.

tripreview.Title: "wrong time of year"
tripreview.sentence: there wasnt any water

tripreview.Title: "Beauty!"
tripreview.sentence: This one is small, there are better waterfalls.
Yet, to me even a smallest waterfall is a beautiful thing in Nature.
Elder people and women may have trouble in reaching exactly below falls, but there is swimming pool like place in front of fall.
So its enjoyable to every one even for my 3 year old son.
After mansoon, it must be heaven in earth.

tripreview.Title: "heaven is coming down"
tripreview.sentence: the surf of water .

tripreview.Title: "Small waterfall"
tripreview.sentence: After seeing the Athirapally waterfalls, this is a trickle off a hillside.
Its nice, if you haven't seen the other one to compare.
Spend a few moments enjoying the breeze from the valley and listening to the sound of gushing water.

tripreview.Title: "Waste of time"
tripreview.sentence: Waste of time, if you're an occasional traveller you must have seen better waterfalls.
This place is a little far away, so reconsider before you waste fuel.

tripreview.Title: "nice place to enjoy the ice cold waterfall"
tripreview.sentence: This would be a nice spot for fun and frolic but during the winter it is almost like stepping in ice cold water.
Unlike me there were a few tourists who went prepared to take bath in the waterfall showers but it is risky and one needs to be a lion heart to brave those cold waters on a winter day.
One board mentioned that they have locker rooms for bathers but in reality there was no such provision.
One should be very careful while walking on the rocky surface under water as it is very slippery and chances are high of bathing in those waters against one's will if you cannot balance in there.
However it is super fun so never mind the cold.

tripreview.Title: "Must watch in Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: Easy access to waterfall
Good controlled flow of water
Space for kids too for enjoying in water

tripreview.Title: "Very romantic drive"
tripreview.sentence: The drive from Munnar to the waterfalls, through misty tea gardens is just so romantic.
:) The waterfall is good but the drive is what makes it worth.

tripreview.Title: "It's a waterfall..."
tripreview.sentence: Not worth making a special trip there to see this, but ok if it's on the way to somewhere else.
You can't get really close to the waterfall unless you are prepared to get your feet wet.
So need to choose appropriate footwear.
The good thing is the waterfall is rather near the main road, so just a short hike.

tripreview.Title: "awesome"
tripreview.sentence: guys.
don't miss this place.
its very nice place to visit.
when we went there in mid November, water level was not high and we could go to the heart of the fall.
and we enjoyed there so much.
peaceful atmosphere with only music of the fall.
it says water level may rise any time, so i don't know how much risky it can be.
but we felt safe over there and spent nice time over there.

tripreview.Title: "worthless drive"
tripreview.sentence: this is not a very good place.
the location is not so beautiful,it is covered with rubbish all over and very smelly, this place is not favorable to visit.
also this place was crowded with the local people and by seeing all those i was really disappointed and felt very bad.

tripreview.Title: "Do not avoid this from your travel plan"
tripreview.sentence: Its on the way to marayoor, a bit off from the usual tourist spots, but the journey to lakkam falls from Rajamalai itself is worth it.

tripreview.Title: "Lock heart gap"
tripreview.sentence: Quite beautiful views here and on the main highway towards thekkedy.

tripreview.Title: "Fantastic View"
tripreview.sentence: Misty cliff with cloudy waters
way through tea gardens, mountains and calm nature
its fantastic experience.
